main_definition: Rotation refers to the circular movement of an object around a center or axis, commonly used in various contexts such as physics, astronomy, business cycles, and everyday activities.

meanings_and_examples.example: The Earth rotates on its axis once approximately every 24 hours.
Mars completes a full rotation around its axis in about 24.6 hours, similar to the length of an Earth day.
The economy is currently in a period of expansion, following a previous contraction phase.
A company employs a rotational management approach, where different team members lead projects every few months to promote collaboration and skill development.
A grocery store changes out its produce display daily to ensure freshness and variety for customers.
